meanings.def: one of four equal parts of something
examples: quarter of something a quarter of an hour/a century
a quarter of a mile/million
Almost a quarter of respondents reported employment discrimination.
three quarters of all potential customers
The programme lasted an hour and a quarter.
Cut the apple into quarters.
The theatre was about three quarters full.
(especially North American English) He completed his last work a quarter century ago.
Cut the apple into quarters.
Two halves make a whole.
I’ve been waiting here for a whole hour.
Half (of) the work is already finished.
They spent half the time looking for a parking space.
Her house is half a mile down the road.
I waited for half an hour.
I waited for a half an hour.
This meal is only half cooked.

meanings.def: a period of 15 minutes either before or after every hour
examples: It’s (a) quarter to four now—I’ll meet you at (a) quarter past.
(North American English also) It's quarter of four now—I'll meet you at quarter after.

meanings.def: a period of three months, used especially as a period for which bills are paid or a company’s income is calculated
examples: The rent is due at the end of each quarter.
Our gas bill for the last quarter was much higher than usual.
Sales were down 10% in the first quarter of 2009.
Profits fell during the third quarter.
the current fiscal quarter
six consecutive quarters of improved earnings

meanings.def: a district or part of a town
examples: the historic quarter of the city
As a student in Paris, she loved the Latin quarter.
The robbery took place in a normally quiet quarter of the town.

meanings.def: a person or group of people, especially as a source of help, information or a reaction
examples: Support for the plan came from an unexpected quarter.
The news was greeted with dismay in some quarters.
The move was met with complaints from all quarters (= from everyone).
The problem was being discussed in all quarters.
There was no comment from official quarters on the allegations.

meanings.def: a coin of the US and Canada worth 25 cents
rooms that are provided for soldiers, servants, etc. to live in
examples: We were moved to more comfortable living quarters.
the servants'/officers' quarters
He was confined to quarters as a punishment.
The corporal and his family lived in married quarters.
the president's private quarters

meanings.def: the period of time twice a month when we can see a quarter of the moon
examples: The moon is in its first quarter.

meanings.def: one of the four periods of time into which a game of American football is divided
examples: Ford scored the winning touchdown early in the fourth quarter.

meanings.def: a unit for measuring weight, a quarter of a pound; 4 ounces
a unit for measuring weight, 28 pounds in the UK or 25 pounds in the US; a quarter of a hundredweight
kind treatment of an enemy or opponent who is in your power
examples: His rivals knew that they could expect no quarter from such a ruthless adversary.
fighting at close quarters
fighting at close quarters

meanings.def: to cut or divide something into four parts
examples: She peeled and quartered an apple.

meanings.def: to provide somebody with a place to eat and sleep
examples: The soldiers were quartered in the town.
